name: PorePy version 1.6.0
body:
# Overview of main changes
This PR contains several major changes that require updates to runscripts:
* The data structures for the mixed-dimensional grid (formally the GridBucket) has been thoroughly overhauled, see https://github.com/pmgbergen/porepy/pull/673#issue-1290569627 for a description of the new framework.
* The interface for export to Paraview has been rewritten, with the new version being more flexible, cleaner and a lot faster. An overview of how to interact with the new structure is given in https://github.com/pmgbergen/porepy/blob/develop/tutorials/exporter.ipynb. 
* The tutorials have been thoroughly overhauled.

# Other notable changes:
* Typing coverage has been much extended.
* Work on an improved 
* Docker files have been updated, these will be further improved in the coming months.
* A test for point-in-polyhedron test has been implemented, removing the need to download an external file and thereby simplifying the installation procedure. 
* Several bugfixes and performance improvements.


# Deprecations
* It is becoming clear that the new Automatic Differentiation framework is the way to go for assembling multiphysics systems. To reduce the burden of maintenance, it has been decided to deprecate the Assembler, together with several associated methods and classes, with deletion scheduled for the second half of 2022. For further details, see https://github.com/pmgbergen/porepy/pull/673#issue-1290569627 (towards the end of the description of the PR). 
* Support for Python 3.7 has been dropped.

## Contributors
The following users made their first contribution to PorePy:
* @OmarDuran made their first contribution in https://github.com/pmgbergen/porepy/pull/600
* @vlipovac made their first contribution in https://github.com/pmgbergen/porepy/pull/619
* @jwboth made their first contribution in https://github.com/pmgbergen/porepy/pull/620
* @enricoballini made their first contribution in https://github.com/pmgbergen/porepy/pull/637
* @IngridKJ made their first contribution in https://github.com/pmgbergen/porepy/pull/671

Also contributing to this release were:
* Alessio Fumagalli
* Eirik Keilegavlen
* Ivar Stefansson
* Jhabriel Varela


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/pmgbergen/porepy/compare/v1.5.0...v1.6.0

name: PorePy version 1.5
body:
Main modifications in this release:
* Overhaul of the Ad framework:
    * The EquationManager has new functionality, clearer interfaces and improved documentation.
    * Syntax has been simplied, e.g. the class Expression has been removed so that evaluation of an Ad expression is done directly on an Operator.
    * General improvements throughout this part of the code.
* Simple functionality for including wells. This should be considered experimental for the time being.
* Introduced a class for time step control, guided by the performance of a non-linear solver.
* Improved robustness of meshing of complex fracture networks.
* General maintenance. 

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/pmgbergen/porepy/compare/v1.4.2...v1.5.0

The following people have contributed to this pull request
* Runar Berge
* Alessio Fumagalli
* Eirik Keilegavlen
* Jhabriel Varela
* Ivar Stefansson

name: PorePy version 1.4.2
body:
Minor changes to Ad framework. Some maintainance.

Contributions by:
* Runar Berge
* Ivar Stefansson
* Eirik Keilegavlen

name: PorePy version 1.4.1
body:
Minor updates:
* Right hand side terms for some THM simulations
* maintenance.

name: PorePy version 1.4.0
body:
This release contains several updates to the code. The most important changes are:

* Substantial improvements to the meshing of fractured domains.
* Introduction of a new abstraction level for the automatic differentiation framework.
* The Biot class for poro-elasticity has clearly been defined as a backend class. To solve poro-elastic problems, use ContactMechanicsBiotModel instead.
* Support for Python 3.9 is introduced, support for 3.6 has been dropped.
* The stable branch has changed name from master to main.

Details:
* Meshing should be faster and more stable, in particular for geometries with many fractures. PorePy now uses the Gmsh python API directly. This can be used to modify mesh size parameters etc., although this has not been explored.
* The new Ad functionality is currently immature, and prone to sudden changes in the API. The hope is that this will become the new framework for defining equations (thus extending the Assembler, which is mainly targeted towards linear problems). The Ad functionality will be expanded over the coming months.

The following people have contributed to this release:
* Runar Lie Berge
* Jakub Both
* Alessio Fumagalli
* Eirik Keilegavlen
* Jhabriel Varela

name: Drop vtk dependency, update of THM models
body:
Changes:
* The Exporter is updated to remove the dependency on the vtk package.
* The models have been updated, with changed names of private functions. 

NOTE: The change to the models will break classes that have been derived from the M/HM/THM contact-mechanics models.

name: Functionality for fracture propagation
body:
This release introduce functionality for fracture propagation. The methodology has been tested for Thermo-poroelastic problems, and is primarily intended to be used in conjunction with the THM models (or the simpler M or HM superclasses).

The grid is not fitted to the predicted path; rather, propagation is implemented as a splitting of a favorably oriented face in the higher-dimensional grid. In general this may (will) lead to weird fracture shapes. The recommended approcah is therefore either to consider cases where the fracture path can be predicted in advance (e.g. tensile regimes) and make the grid accordingly, or to implement a remeshing approach externally to PorePy.

The propagation criteria are implemented as a class that is intended to be combined with the THM-class models, using double inheritance. This is a temporary construct, which may (will) be fundamentally redesigned at some point in the future.

name: Maintanence
body:
Several relatively minor updates to the code. Most important:
* In projections to and from MortarGrids, the terminology 'master' and 'slave' has been replaced by 'primary' and 'secondary'.
* Increased used of typing; compatibility with mypy and flake8 is now enforced on pull requests.
* Several other changes

Update to Python 3.9, and end of support for 3.6, has been postponed to v1.4. This will likely happen before the end of the year.

name: Update MPxA discretizations
body:
If parameters, or the grid, is modified in parts of the domain, substantial computational savings can be gained by only discretizing a small region around the modifications.

The updated can be invoked directly, or via the Assembler's update_discretization method.

This should still be considered immature code, and used with care.

name: Periodic boundary conditions in Mpfa
body:
Periodic boundary conditions are now available in Mpfa as well as Tpfa.

Note that the condition for periodicity is moved from the BoundaryCondition class to the Grid.

Also other minor fixes.

name: Change sign convention in contact mechanics
body:
With the new convention, positive normal jumps corresponds to open fractures.

No updates of run scripts should be necessary.

Note that the implementation no longer follows the contact mechanics formulation as laid out in Berge et al 2020.

name: New approach to filtering in Assembler
body:
Overview
* Assembler operations (discretize, assembly) can be assembled with a new AssembleFilter class. This generalizes the previous rudimentary filtering options. Filtering can now be done on grids (standard grids, interfaces, or couplings), variable and term names.
* Two filters are available through pp.assembler_filters: AllPassFilter (will be invoked unless a filter is set), and ListFilter.
* The old active_variables keyword in the assembler is made defunct.

Runscripts may need to be updated due to these changes. The contact mechanics models have been updated.
Update code base to be compatible with flake8

name: PorePy version 1.2.0
body:
Verious updates to the code, including:
* Improved meshing functionality
* More or less standardized setups for Thermo-hydro-mechanical DFM simulations with contact mechanics
* Performance enhancements
* Bugfixes

name: Mpfa with consistent discretization of vector sources
Version 1.0.0
body: Substantial update of the entire code base. Changes in runscripts are most likely necessary.

name: Improved boundary conditions for mpsa, various other changes.
body:
* Improved boundary conditions for elasticity calculations.
* Runscripts for new archive paper. 
* Various other changes.

name: Benchmark for 3d dfm simulations
body:
Simulations and scripts to create results for the benchmark described in http://arxiv.org/abs/1809.06926

Also other minor fixes.

name: Robin boundary condition for finite volume methods
Changes to P1 FEM and exporter
body:
Several minor changes.

This is the version used to generate results in the paper 'Unified approach to discretization of flow in fractured porous media' by Nordbotten et al.

name: Mortar methods, automatic differentiation
body:
Major update of the code base:
* Introduced mortar grids on the interface between grids in different dimensions,
* Flow and transport discretizations uses mortar variables for communication between grids,
* Implementation of automatic differentiation capabilities,
* Various other improvements and modifications.

name: Various improvements
body: Minor additions and improvements.

name: Hybrid_FV paper
body: Version of code used to produce the paper 'Hybrid Dimensional Finite Volume Discretizations for Fractured Porous Media'.

name: arXiv:1712:00460.
body: Also various updates.

name: Fix gmsh import after update to meshio
body: Need to upgrade to meshio >=1.10 at the same time.
